knowledge.heading: Innocence Exposes Adult Hypocrisy
knowledge.description: The text uses childlike perception to reveal the contradictions and moral failures of adult society. Scout's innocent questions and observations strip away social pretenses to expose the gap between stated values and actual behavior.
knowledge.pattern_connection: Scout's innocent perspective combined with dramatic irony allows readers to see adult prejudices and moral blindness more clearly than the characters themselves can.

device_examples.quote: Atticus had to, whether he wanted to
device_examples.effect: Scout's misunderstanding reveals the community's deeper moral failure in expecting lawyers to provide inadequate defense.
The trial as entertainment symbolizes society's moral decay that Scout innocently observes without understanding its full horror.
